page.title: 06KENDERCHURCH CHURCH
page.content:
The church is a local landmark, situated on a hill above the A465 road. Its circular churchyard indicates that it has been a place of {worship}for over 1000 years, and a legacy prevented closure in 1977. Since then, monthly services, attended by about twelve people, have been held from Easter to October, and there have been two christenings in the chalice shaped{Norman font.}
From the churchyard, which contains an incised slab of Norman times and a cross with a medievel base, there os a fine view of the{Golden Valley}which still glows with corn in the summer months. It seems that the church has survived through the dedicated farmers and their friends who care for the church as well as their land.
